info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 2 at 1:54PM MST until July 2 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 154 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain along Big Bug creek. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, normally dry washes, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mayer, Spring Valley, Cordes Lakes and Cordes Junction.
This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Turkey Creek, Big Bug Creek, Cedar Creek, Antelope Creek, Little Wolf Creek, Lynx Creek, Grapevine Creek, Pine Creek, Hackberry Creek and Wolf Creek.
info.instruction:
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons, and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR BIG BUG CREEK IN YAVAPAI COUNTY
